verses.verse: After he had called his twelve disciples, he gave them authority over unclean spirits--to cast them out--and to heal every sickness and every disease.
These are the names of the twelve apostles. The first is Simon, who is called Peter, then Andrew, his brother; James the son of Zebedee and John his brother;
Philip; Bartholomew; Thomas; Matthew, the tax collector; James the son of Alphaeus; then Lebbeus surnamed Thaddaeus;
Simon the Canaanite, and Judas Iscariot who betrayed him.
Jesus sent these twelve out and commanded them saying, "Do not go into the Gentile area and do not enter a Samaritan city.
"Go instead to the lost sheep of the House of Israel.
"As you travel, preach, saying: «The Kingdom of heaven is close at hand.»
"Heal the sick, cleanse the lepers, raise the dead, and cast out devils. You received without cost, so give without cost,
don't take gold, silver, or brass in your money belts,
or a lunch bag for your journey, or two tunics, sandals, or walking sticks, for the workman is worthy of his food.
"Whatever city or village you enter, find out who is worthy in it and stay there until you leave.
"When you come into a house, greet those in it.
"And if the family is worthy, let you blessing of peace come on it, but if it is not worthy, let your blessing of peace return to you.
"Whosoever will not receive you or listen to you message, when you leave that family or city, shake the dust off your feet.
"Truly I say to you that it will be more tolerable for the land of Sodom and Gomorrah in the Day of Judgment than for that city.
"Look, I am sending you out as sheep in the midst of wolves, therefore be as wise as serpents and harmless as doves.
"But beware of men, for they will hand you over to councils and will flog you in their synagogues.
"You will be brought before governors and kings for my sake for a testimony against them and the gentiles.
"But when they hand you over, don't be anxious how or what you will say, for it will be given to you at that very hour, what you will say.
"For it is not you who speaks but the Spirit of your Father who speaks through you.
"Brother will hand brother over to death and father the child, and children will rise up against their parents and cause them to be killed.
"You will be hated by all for my name's sake, but he who endures to the end will be saved.
"But when they persecute you in this city, flee to another, for truly I say to you that you will not have gone to every city in Israel before the Son of Man comes.
"A disciple is not greater than his teacher or a slave greater than his master.
"It is enough for the disciple that he would become like his teacher and the servant like his master. If they have called the head of the family, Beelzebub, then how much more those of his family?
"Therefore, don't be afraid of them, for there is nothing covered up that won't be uncovered nor a secret that won't be known.
"What I tell in you in the dark, speak in the light, and what you hear with your ear, announce on the housetops.
"Do not fear those who kill the body but are not able to kill the soul, instead fear him who is able to destroy both soul and body in hell.
"Aren't two sparrows sold for a penny? Yet not one of them can fall to the ground without your Father.
"But the very hairs of your head are all counted.
"Don't be afraid therefore, you are more valuable than many sparrows.
"So then, whosoever will confess me openly before people, I also will confess openly before my Father who is in heaven.
"But whosoever denies me before people, I also will deny before my Father who is in heaven.
"Don't think that I came to bring peace on the earth; I didn't come to bring peace but a sword.
"For I came to alienate a man from his father and the daughter against her mother and the daughter-in-law against her mother-in-law.
"A man's foes will be those of his own family.
"He who loves father or mother more than me is not worthy of me, and he who loves son or daughter more than me is not worthy of me.
"He who doesn't take his cross and follow after me is not worthy of me.
"He who finds his life will lose it, and he who loses his life for my sake will find it.
"He who welcomes you, welcomes me, and he who welcomes me, welcomes him who sent me.
"He who welcomes a prophet in the name of a prophet will receive a prophet's reward, and he who welcomes a righteous man in the name of a righteous man will receive a righteous man's reward.
"Whoever will give a drink to one of these little ones, even just a cup of cold water, because he is a disciple, will, I truly say to you, not lose his reward."
